school.name: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

projects.title: 9th Global Social Business Summit - Berlin
projects.description:
The Global Social Business Summit – The Gathering 2019 will have an outstanding character as we will work on the next 30 years of the social business and microfinance movement.

Therefore, this year´s Global Social Business Summit will bring together the social business and microfinance family – the closest circle of inspirational speakers and opinion leaders from the social business and microfinance movement, private sectors, civil societies, governments and academia.

During two days of meetings, forums and workshops, this event will be decisive of the next years of the social business and microfinance movement as the most noble of social business entrepreneurs worldwide will build taskforces ahead of The SuperHappYYness Festival on the 28th of June 2020, in which framework Professor Yunus will celebrate his notable 80th Birthday, and where the results of the working groups will be presented. The topics of the event will cover poverty reduction, entrepreneurship creation, the environment and climate change, health, education, sports, arts and culture – with a view to generate commitments and action plans from all those attending. Our collective goal will be to charter a path that we’ll follow collectively for the next 30 years, to transform the planet by 2050 and build a new civilization.

projects.title: 9th Social Business Day - Bangkok
projects.description:
Social Business Day is an annual two-day conference organized by the Yunus Centre, and is hosted by Nobel Laureate Professor Muhammad Yunus.  The conference serves to highlight developments in the realm of social business and to provide social entrepreneurs with the opportunity to connect with established individuals in the field. It is one of the largest gatherings of the social business community, bringing together leading experts, academics, innovators, and aspiring business owners. The conference has previously been held in destinations including Dhaka, Bangladesh and Bangalore, India. This year, the conference will be hosted by the Yunus Center at the Asian Institute of Technology (YCA) and take place in Bangkok, Thailand. Other local supporters of Social Business Day include the Yunus Social Business Centre Kasetsart University (YSBCKU) and the Thailand Social Business Initiative (TSBI).

As the first conference taking place in Bangkok, Social Business Day 2019 will bring together more than 1,000 delegates from all over the world in the field of social business, along with icons of social innovation and entrepreneurship from 30 countries. Trailblazers in various fields and industries will be able to explore their experience with social business as a unique enterprise-led development approach that can make the world a better place.

projects.title: 8th Global Social Business Summit - Wolfsburg
projects.description:
Global Social Business Summit
The GSBS is the worldwide leading forum for Social Business. It serves to spread awareness about Social Business, foster discussion and collaboration between practitioners and stakeholders, as well as present and conceive best practices.

The annual event is organized by the Nobel Peace Prize laureate professor Muhammad Yunus and his creative advisor Hans Reitz, and gathers experts from the private sector, civil society, governments and academia over a few days of meetings, forums and workshops.

The main topics of the GSBS 2018 will be Plastic & Circular Economy, Mobility, Solidarity, Sports & Social Business and Food & Its Value.

profile_positions.description: As the Project Owner at ProjectTogether's Welcome Alliance, I'm leading the Opportunity Fund initiative, a mission-driven project that aims to integrate migrants and refugees into the German labor market. The Opportunity Fund empowers underserved communities by providing access to quality education through microcredits. In this role, I strategize and implement innovative solutions to ensure access to educational opportunities, driving social justice, and fostering inclusivity. I'm passionate about making a tangible impact on individuals' lives and contributing to a more equitable society.
profile_positions.title: Entrepreneur in Residence

profile_positions.description:
As a Managing Partner at Careery, I am dedicated to facilitating the integration of refugees and immigrants into the German labor market. We collaborate with NGOs and up-skilling programs to empower our talents with language proficiency, cultural integration, and essential skills for contributing to a sustainable future in our society.

Our mission extends to supporting the DEI initiatives of our partner companies by offering a comprehensive reverse mentoring program. This innovative approach bridges socio-cultural and professional gaps between their employees and immigrants/refugees, fostering a more inclusive and innovative work environment that benefits all parties involved.

Additionally, we provide tailored recruiting support for companies looking to diversify their workforce, leveraging our unique insights and access to a pool of diverse talents. By partnering with Careery, companies can enhance their diversity and inclusion efforts while simultaneously empowering refugees and immigrants to thrive in their new professional environments.

company.name: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

profile_positions.company: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University
profile_positions.description:
🌟 Empowering Interdisciplinary Teams to Drive Innovation and Create Impactful Technology Strategies 🌟

As an Innovation Coach for the Coaching for Innovation elective course, I am dedicated to unlocking the full potential of interdisciplinary teams consisting of IBA students from Rotterdam School of Management (RSM) and Applied Physics students from TU Delft. My passion lies in fostering a collaborative team culture that encourages innovation, creativity, and strategic thinking.

🚀 Key Responsibilities:

• Guiding 10 interdisciplinary teams in the development of cutting-edge technology strategies for leading Dutch companies
• Facilitating a collaborative environment that inspires open communication, active listening, and effective problem-solving
• Nurturing a growth mindset and encouraging continuous learning among team members
• Implementing effective coaching techniques to support team development, enhance innovation skills, and promote the adoption of new ideas and technologies
• Providing expert advice on the latest industry trends, challenges, and best practices to help teams make informed strategic decisions

💡 What Sets Me Apart:

My unique combination of business acumen and technical expertise enables me to bridge the gap between IBA and Applied Physics students, fostering an atmosphere of seamless collaboration and mutual understanding. By cultivating a culture of innovation and creativity, I empower teams to think outside the box and develop strategies that drive real change in the industry.

Join me on this exciting journey as we explore the world of innovation and shape the future of technology together. Let's connect and create a lasting impact!
profile_positions.title: Innovation Coach | Collaborative Team Culture & Technology Strategy Development

profile_positions.company: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University
profile_positions.title: Honours Student MSc Management of Innovation

profile_positions.company: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University
profile_positions.description:
Weaving together what belongs.

The UN's Sustainable Development Goals are guiding us today in our transformation to a better tomorrow. The Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University recognizes the SDGs as the guiding framework for its mission to be a force for positive change in the world.  I'm honoured and grateful to be selected as #SDG-Ambassador by the Positive Change Initiative of the RSM.

There are so many amazing activists, social entrepreneurs, youth organizations, NGOs, charities, teachers, business and spiritual leaders, artists, and athletes, who are ALL making remarkable contributions to the SDGs. If you're reading this, you're most likely one of them! 

That's why my focus will be on SDG 17: Partnerships to reach the goals. 
In this role, I will actively form impactful partnerships on many levels of the Erasmian Community and beyond to advance the SDGs more effectively, by fostering more collaboration between organizations and communities, individuals and collectives, and people and planet.

Weaving together what belongs.
profile_positions.title: SDG-Ambassador 17: Partnerships to reach the goals

profile_positions.description: The AIT Analytics Academy is offering two immersive, learning-by-doing professional certificate programs in Data Analytics and Cybersecurity. Developed in collaboration with industry leaders Socratic Arts, the programs will offer prospective students with a learning approach that is action-oriented and story-based. This will provide a distinct cutting-edge and future-oriented methodology that boosts the strong foundations set by the online curriculum, while also providing students with valuable and employable real-world skills.
